Legal_Issue: Whether the Board's decision to reject the refugee claim was procedurally fair and adequately reasoned
Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution by FARC in Colombia
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of clear reasoning on subjective fear and state protection
Review_Outcome: Decision quashed, matter remitted to a different panel
Evidence_Ignored: Insufficient analysis of subjective fear and state protection
Decision_Outcome: Refugee claim dismissed due to inadequate reasoning
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Decision_Review_Issue: Adequacy of reasons and procedural fairness
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Clear reasoning required for conclusions under procedural fairness
Cause_of_Refusal: Principal Applicant feared persecution by FARC but claim was denied due to unclear Board reasoning
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of clarity in analyzing evidence
Procedural_Fairness: Board failed to meet standards of procedural fairness
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge based on procedural unfairness and inadequate reasoning
Procedural_Issue: Inadequate reasons provided by decision maker
Omission_Type: Failure to explain reasoning on key elements of claim
